intro: Arthraxon okamotoi, commonly known as the Japanese arrowgrass, is a herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Arthraxon okamotoi is typically found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and wetland conservation.
